A SNOMED concept refset contains references to SNOMED concepts that have been selected for a specific purpose. If either the definition of the refset - i.e. its specification refset, or the concepts which are referenced change, the refset will likely need to be refreshed and systematically reviewed. In addition to the "wizard" for creating refsets, there is a corresponding wizard for guiding participants through the workflow necessary to re-edit and review any changes. The entire worflow is best illustrated by the following series of workflow diagrams, based on "swimlines", each of which represents the tasks of a particular role in the business process in the sequence in which they are undertaken. The first part, , starts with the owner initiating the request, by starting the business process and completing some forms. The wizard is invoked from the refset tab of the concept panel using the button. Refreshing a refset workflow part 1
The next part of the workflow, part 2 in shows the workbench's Refresh Reset business process presenting more forms to the owner of the refset, finalising the initialisation of the refset with sufficient metadata to hand over the process to the role responsible for authoring the specification of the refset. Refreshing a refset workflow - part 2
The next part, 3 in shows the editor collecting the refset specification and authoring or editing the refset specification. The editor can suspend editing at any stage by saving his/her work and reopening it later using the todo inbox queue. Refreshing a refset workflow - part 3
The next part, 4 in shows the editor completing the specification process and passing the refset to the reviewer. The workbench automatically computes the members of the refset in preparation of the review process. Refreshing a refset workflow - part 4
The next part, 5 in shows the reviewer completing his/her review process and passing the results back to the owner, via the owner's inbox. Refreshing a refset workflow - part 5
The next part, 6 in shows the workbench automatically computing the resultant refset based on any changes, and interacting with the owner to accept or reject any changes. Refreshing a refset workflow - part 6
The next part, 7 in shows the workbench offering the owner the option to export the final refset in a tab-delimited file, and optionally passing the refset to a Subject Matter Expert (SME)subject matter expert (SME)SME - subject matter expert for additional final review. Refreshing a refset workflow - part 7
The finalpart, 8 in shows the workbench creating a separate viewer workflow (under construction) for use by an external subject matter expert. Refreshing a refset workflow - part 8
